This type of proceeding is sufficiently flexible so that
all the various alternatives could be explored, and the JCET
would have the opportunity to sake a general showing of need and
achievement.
However, it is our further recommendation that the
proceeding should not be limited to a general investigation
under Rule 1.10* Rather, it should be coupled with a petition
for rule-making under Section 1,202 which describes the
procedure to be followed in requests for changes in rules. Our
petition for rule-making should request amendment of the rules
embodying the TV channel allocations, so as to put an asterisk
(signifying an educational reservation) on relocated Channel 12
which can be made available for ETV in either Detroit or Cleveland,
and another asterisk on Channel 13 which will become available
in Rochester The petition should also request that the FCC
adopt a new rule, under which any new VHF channel assignment
would be reserved for educational use, unless coverage is already
being provided by an existing YHF educational station or there Is
a YHF reservation.
It is our belief that the Commission would entertain such
a proceeding and give serious consideration to the problems
discussed in this memorandum. If the Commission does not take
favorable action, other and more drastic procedures are available*
